front.title: Alternative Approach for Mixing Preshared Keys in IKEv2 for Post-quantum Security

abstract.t: An IKEv2 extension defined in [I-D.ietf-ipsecme-qr-ikev2] allows IPsec traffic to be protected against someone storing VPN communications today and decrypting it later, when (and if) quantum computers are available. However, this protection doesn't cover an initial IKEv2 SA, which might be unacceptable in some scenarios. This specification defines an alternative way get the same protection against quantum computers, which allows to extend it on the initial IKEv2 SA.
